body: Osabutey argues that West Africa seems likely to be hit by Jasmine’s smell: "As protestors in Egypt continue to push out dictator Hosni Mubarak out of office after three decades in office, anti dictator activists in West Africa are keeping their fingers under lock to see if the dose of the Jasmine will surely spread across their region."
original_body: Osabutey argues that West Africa seems likely to be hit by Jasmine’s smell: "As protestors in Egypt continue to push out dictator Hosni Mubarak out of office after three decades in office, anti dictator activists in West Africa are keeping their fingers under lock to see if the dose of the Jasmine will surely spread across their region."
title: Africa: Is the smell of jasmine hitting West Africa?

sentence: Osabutey argues that West Africa seems likely to be hit by Jasmine’s smell: "As protestors in Egypt continue to push out dictator Hosni Mubarak out of office after three decades in office, anti dictator activists in West Africa are keeping their fingers under lock to see if the dose of the Jasmine will surely spread across their region."
